metadata.Title: CVE-2017-20005 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
NGINX before 1.13.6 has a buffer overflow for years that exceed four digits, as demonstrated by a file with a modification date in 1969 that causes an integer overflow (or a false modification date far in the future), when encountered by the autoindex module.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-20005` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
nginx-common - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
nginx-core - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
nginx-extras - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
nginx-full - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
nginx-light - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nginx package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2').
